About this Document

About &Yap;
This section is borrowed from the XDVI help file.
You use &Yap; (Yet Another Previewer) to view &DVI; files, such as are produced by &TeX;.
&Yap; has the capability of showing the file shrunken by various (integer) factors, and also has a magnifying glass which allows one to see a small part of the unshrunk image momentarily.
Before displaying any page or part thereof, &Yap; checks to see if the &DVI; file has changed since the last time it was displayed. If this is the case, then &Yap; will reinitialize itself for the modified &DVI; file.
How to Open a File
&DVI; file opening
There are several ways to open a file:
by double-clicking a &DVI; file icon in the Windows shell (Explorer)
by dragging a &DVI; file icon to the &Yap; application window
by specifying a file name on the &Yap; command-line (see ).
by clicking Open... on the File menu.
by clicking an MRU (most recently used}
MRU (most recently used) files opeing
item on the File menu.
You can open more than one file with a single instance of &Yap;.
Viewing &DVI; Files
Render Methods
&Yap; supports two render methods:
render methods
render method Pk
render method Dvips
Pk
The &DVI; file is rendered using packed raster fonts. This is the traditional method to render &DVI; files.
Dvips
The &DVI; file is rendered using &Dvips;/&Ghostscript;. This render method is suitable for &DVI; files which contain &PostScript; instructions.
PostScript specials
(e.g., rotated text and graphics).
The render method for the viewed &DVI; file can be chosen in the View menu ().
The default render method can be chosen on the Display property page ().
Magnifying and Reducing the View
magnifying the view
reducing the view
zooming
To increase magnification, either click the Zoom In button on the tool bar, or press + on the numeric keypad.
To decrease magnification, either click the Zoom Out button on the tool bar, or press - on the numeric keypad.
Setting the Page Layout
page layout setting the
You can choose among four page layouts when viewing &DVI; files:
Single Page Layout displays one page in the document at a time.
Double Page Layout displays two pages in the document at a time.
Continuous/Single Page Layout arranges the pages in a continuous vertical column.
Continuous/Double Page Layout arranges the pages side by side in a continuous vertical column.
To set the page layout, either click one of the four layout buttons in the tool bar, or click one of the four layout commands on the context menu.
Presenting Documents in Full Screen View
full screen mode
presentations
In Full Screen view, &DVI; pages fill the entire screen; the menu bar, tool bar and status bar are hidden. Full Screen view is often used for presentations. The pointer remains active in Full Screen view so that you can click links. You can use keybord shortcuts () for navigational and magnification commands.
To present a document in Full Screen view, click Full Screen on the View menu. To exit Full Screen view, press Escape.
Goto Page Dialog Box
page displaying a random
The Goto Page dialog lets you select a &TeX; page number. The corresponding document location is scrolled into view when you close the dialog box.
